sections.title: 3D imaging that supports precise dentistry
sections.body: CBCT scans and intraoral 3D scans create a detailed map of your teeth, bone, and soft tissue. They guide implants, surgical planning, airway assessments, and restorative work while keeping interventions conservative.
bullets: Visualise bone height and nerve positions
Plan implant angles and restoration space
Assess impacted teeth or sinus proximity
Share findings and next steps transparently

sections.title: Calibrated CBCT and intraoral scanning
sections.body: Our imaging uses calibrated protocols to capture accurate data with minimal dose. Intraoral scans replace traditional impressions for comfort and precision.

faqs.question: Is the radiation dose high?
faqs.answer: We use low-dose protocols and only scan when clinically justified. We will explain dose considerations before proceeding.

faqs.question: Will I feel anything during the scan?
faqs.answer: CBCT is quick and non-invasive. Intraoral scans avoid putty impressions for better comfort.

faqs.question: Can I have the scan for my specialist?
faqs.answer: Yes. We can securely share the data and reports with your wider care team as needed.

faqs.question: Do I always need both CBCT and intraoral scans?
faqs.answer: Not always. We choose the imaging that best answers the clinical question and keep exposure minimal.

faqs.question: How soon will I know the results?
faqs.answer: We review the findings with you and outline next steps promptly, often during the same visit.
